definition[0]: if advantages accrue to you, you get those advantages over a period of time
example[1]: advantages accruing from the introduction of new technology
definition[1]: if money accrues or is accrued, it gradually increases over a period of time
example[2]: Interest will accrue until payment is made.
definition[2]: if an amount of money accrues, or is accrued, it gradually increases over a period of time
example[3]: The tax falls due at the end of the month, and interest will accrue from that date.
definition[3]: if profits or benefits accrue to you, or are accrued, you have the right to receive them
example[4]: If profits are insufficient, no additional rights accrue to the holder of the bond.
example[5]: Your employer cannot withhold your benefits accrued from mandatory contributions.
